article.title: Experimental generalized quantum suppression law in Sylvester interferometers

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of parametric down-conversion (PDC) sources are used in the experiment?
How is the injection of single photons into specific input modes of the interferometer heralded in the scattershot regime?
choices: By detecting a specific phase shift in the output.
By detecting the corresponding twin photon.
By analyzing the polarization state of the output photons.
By measuring the time delay between the emitted photons.

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of detectors are used to collect the photons at the output of the interferometer?
What is the purpose of the delay lines (DL) with motorized stages in the experimental setup?
choices: To compensate for different path lengths and ensure temporal indistinguishability of the photons.
To introduce a specific phase shift between the photons in different modes.
To filter out unwanted wavelengths and improve the spectral purity of the photons.
To adjust the polarization state of the photons before entering the interferometer.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the recursive construction of what type of matrix?

choices: The number of photons used in the experiment.
The number of modes in the interferometer.
The dimension of the Sylvester matrix is 2 raised to the power of "p".
A constant factor used to normalize the matrix elements.
